Package net.marfgamer.jraknet.server

Class RakNetServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.marfgamer.jraknet.server.RakNetServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RakNetServerListener, GeminusRakNetPeer
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    RakNetServerBundleExample

    public class RakNetServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements GeminusRakNetPeer, RakNetServerListener
    Used to easily create servers using the RakNet protocol.
    Author:
    Whirvis "MarfGamer" Ardenaur

      • sendMessage

        public final EncapsulatedPacket sendMessage​(long guid,
                                            Reliability reliability,
                                            int channel,
                                            Packet packet)
        Description copied from interface: GeminusRakNetPeer
        Sends a message with the specified reliability on the specified channel to the session with the specified globally unique ID and returns a copy of the generated encapsulated packet that will be used when it is actually sent.
        Specified by:
        sendMessage in interface GeminusRakNetPeer
        Parameters:
        guid - the globally unique ID of the session.
        reliability - the reliability of the packet.
        channel - the channel to send the packet on.
        packet - the packet to send.
        Returns:
        the generated encapsulated packet.

      • blockAddress

        public final void blockAddress​(java.net.InetAddress address,
                               java.lang.String reason,
                               long time)
        Blocks the address and disconnects all the clients on the address with the specified reason for the specified amount of time.
        Parameters:
        address - the address to block.
        reason - the reason the address was blocked.
        time - how long the address will blocked in milliseconds.

      • blockAddress

        Parameters:

        time - how long the address will blocked in milliseconds.

      • validateSender

        private final RakNetPacket validateSender​(java.net.InetSocketAddress sender)
        Validates the sender during login to make sure there are no problems.
        Parameters:
        sender - the address of the packet sender.
        Returns:
        the packet to respond with if there was an error.

      • sendNettyMessage

        public final void sendNettyMessage​(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buf,
                                   java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
        Sends a raw message to the specified address. Be careful when using this method, because if it is used incorrectly it could break server sessions entirely! If you are wanting to send a message to a session, you are probably looking for the sendMessage method.
        Parameters:
        buf - the buffer to send.
        address - the address to send the buffer to.

      • sendNettyMessage

        public final void sendNettyMessage​(Packet packet,
                                   java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
        Sends a raw message to the specified address. Be careful when using this method, because if it is used incorrectly it could break server sessions entirely! If you are wanting to send a message to a session, you are probably looking for the sendMessage method.
        Parameters:
        packet - the buffer to send.
        address - the address to send the buffer to.

      • sendNettyMessage

        public final void sendNettyMessage​(int packetId,
                                   java.net.InetSocketAddress address)
        Sends a raw message to the specified address. Be careful when using this method, because if it is used incorrectly it could break server sessions entirely! If you are wanting to send a message to a session, you are probably looking for the sendMessage method.
        Parameters:
        packetId - the ID of the packet to send.
        address - the address to send the packet to.
